Description: Body sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery band-cup; interor glazed black; exterior: in reserved handle zone, horse to left (forelegs, part of chest and under belly remaining); at left, perhaps part of handle root; dot as filling ornament; below, black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 407, no. B616)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1392) (phase 3)
